-- This function returns the nth number in the Fibonacci sequence
-- @param n the index of the number to be returned
-- @return the nth number in the Fibonacci sequence
function getFibonacci(n)
    -- base case: first and second number are 0 and 1 respectively
    if n == 0 then return 0
    elseif n == 1 then return 1
    else
        -- for n >= 2, the Fibonacci sequence is generated by adding the previous two numbers
        local first = 0 -- first number in the sequence
        local second = 1 -- second number in the sequence
        local result = 0 -- variable to store the nth number
        for i = 2, n do
            result = first + second
            first = second
            second = result
        end
        return result
    end
end 

-- Example usage: print the 10th number in the Fibonacci sequence
print(getFibonacci(10)) 

-- Output: 55
